title: Why can Jayce have a better [1 out of 2] active R resistance stats than Wukong's passive?
body:
{{champion:126}}  is a "uniquely" designed champ, sure, but he's overloaded af!
This dude has everything you need in his ~~kit~~ 2 kits,   MS steroid, ranged and melee modes [melee makes him a bit tankier], Slow, knockback,  both Magic and physical damage on a high scaling, Damage amplifier, AS steroid, %HP damage, Armor and MR % shred.

One of his R actives "going to Melee mode" allows him to gain more MR and armor instantly! not only that, but he gains extra damage on his next AA.
Why is he rewarded with both durability and damage when he goes Melee? I dont get it, he outranges you  ok ok thats fine, but when you try to duel him in what is supposed to be his [weakness]  melee mode, he still destroys you with both more AD scaling damage, %HP damage and more resistance.

Transform Mercury Cannon CANNON STANCE - ACTIVE: Jayce transforms the Transform Mercury Cannon Mercury Cannon into the Mercury Hammer, gaining new abilities, becoming Melee role melee, gaining 5 / 15 / 25 / 35 bonus armor and bonus magic resistance, and causing his next basic attack to deal 25 / 65 / 105 / 145 (+ 25% bonus AD) bonus magic damage.

Jayce begins the game with Transform but cannot increase its rank. Instead, his basic abilities each have 6 ranks.

He gets that amount just by pressing R, meanwhile {{champion:62}}  gets  t level 16 8 [MR + armor] x 5 [each NEARBY champion] and those stats are lost when they die.

Feels good to win the game just by choosing the right champion these days.

Because Jayce has "ranged champion" base stats, so he's encouraged to go into melee by being given better resistances.

That's like asking why Kayle gets more range from her E than Twitch does from his R.

This is the actual answer here, Jayce has the base stats of a ranged champion, so in order for him to become melee worthy, he gains the resistances a normal melee champion.
Keep in mind this champion is almost as old as {{champion:62}}, and both of them have some pretty outdated passives. If Jayce were to be made today/reworked, he'd probably have a more meaningful difference between melee and ranged.

The way I see Jayce right now is to stay ranged unless you can all in or need to defend yourself against someone who can close the gap, it doesn't really do anything but allow him a higher burst at the risk of getting killed.

It comes down to the simple fact that {{champion:62}}  has not been touched in about 4 years now aside from global changes to all champs here and there. {{champion:126}}  has been re adjusted a few times over that time, letting Riot adjust him in a way that takes into account the power creep that has been increasing every season. Meanwhile {{champion:62}} has been perpetually put in a state of "He's fine and doesn't need help" by Riot, making his passive age further and further to the point it's become less effective.
In short, his passive is like an egg thats been kept in the fridge too long. It had a pretty decent shelf life, but its starting to leave a bad smell >_>

It stands to reason that when Wukong *FINALLY* gets updated, he will likely have a more interesting passive that will take into account the current game balance and hopefully try to rework his passive into something that will be more effective in the current game then his current one. The ball is just in Riots court on WHEN we will see that update happen at this point.
